column4: hi i just installed ubuntu hoary hedgehog and tried to get my mini ipod to work. I have read the howto in the wiki but ubuntu is not detecting it and /dev/sda2 does not exist. Any ideas?
does HAL run automatically? or do i have to run it?
unless you've been mucking around with your config, hald should start up automatically, yep
any ideas why and ipod would not be automatically detected and added to /dev?
no idea. are you running Warty, or Hoary, or a combination of both?
still there?
yes
Ubuntu Warty, I've noticed, doesn't work all the time with some USB mass storage devices... have you tried a flashdrive or digital camera or portable HD or MP3 player in it before?
when I upgraded to Hoary (I think it's mostly safe to by now), my MP3 flashdrive that didn't work before, magically started working.
did not work in either
wait... doesn't show up in /dev at all? you s hould find it by going "ls /dev/sd*"
USB drives work on the SCSI emulation layer
no such file
that's really weird; do you have any other sort of USB storage device yo ucan test out?
no
I dunno; iPod should work straight out of the box. you're plugging it in through USB, I suppose, not FireWire?
/var/log/messages doesnt get a new entry when its plugged in

most definitely there's no driver there... unfortunately I don't have any experience with an iPod (except I played with the yummy scroll wheel on a friend's iPod the other day)... I wouldn't know how to get it going if it's not automatically detected.
im thinking its the motherboard
could be... hmmm
(hope it's not, for your sake)
thanks for your help. bye
